name: Charles Darwin
achievements: Theory of Evolution by Natural Selection
Author of 'On the Origin of Species'
biography: Charles Robert Darwin was an English naturalist, geologist and biologist, best known for his contributions to the science of evolution. His proposition that all species of life have descended over time from common ancestors is now widely accepted and considered a foundational concept in science.
quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.

name: Gregor Mendel
biography: Gregor Johann Mendel was a meteorologist, mathematician, biologist, Augustinian friar and abbot of St. Thomas' Abbey in Brno. He is famous for his work on heredity and is known as the father of modern genetics.
quote: My scientific studies have afforded me great gratification; and I am convinced that it will not be long before the whole world acknowledges the results of my work.

name: Rosalind Franklin
achievements: Contributed to discovery of DNA double helix
Research on RNA and virus structures
biography: Rosalind Elsie Franklin was an English chemist and X-ray crystallographer whose work was central to the understanding of the molecular structures of DNA, RNA, tobacco mosaic virus, and polio virus.
quote: Science and everyday life cannot and should not be separated.
